ygData.subject: Re: [rest-discuss] Re: DELETE container?
ygData.msgSnippet: I can t think of *any* resource I have a name for which I have no representation.  The very act of naming it means I have a representation. Your retirement ,

I can't think of *any* resource I have a name for which I have no
representation.  The very act of naming it means I have a representation.
"Your retirement", for instance, still has a representation.  In this case
it may be "what it will be like" or "never get around to having one" (or
whatever your represtentation of it currently is).  I bet you can't talk or
even think of your retirement without conjuring up a single representation
of it.  I know I can't.

---
Seairth Jacobs
seairth@...

From: "Walden Mathews" <waldenm@...>
>
> I believe this, in essence, is what Roy Fielding meant when he
> said [somewhere] "resources always exist".
>
> And why not?  You have a concept, no current way to express
> (represent) it, but you still have name(s) for it.  For example,
> "my retirement".
>
> From: "Seairth Jacobs" <seairth@...>
> >
> > How can you DELETE the representation-to-resource mapping and still have
> > the identifier-to-resource mapping exist?
